basis

Class TCPClientListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • basis.TCPClientListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TCPClientListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The client listener is responsible for accepting incoming TCP connections and creating, for each of those, a communicator that will enable the server to exchange with them. This class can be instantiated multiple times to listen on several network ports.
    Author:
    Nicolas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private TCPClientHandler handler
      The client handler that is passed to created communicators and which enables a client to call the server back when specific events occur.
      private java.lang.Thread listenerThread
      The thread in charge of running the client listener mechanics.
      private static org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER 
      private int port
      The network port on which to listen connections.
      private java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket
      The server socket used to accept incoming TCP communications.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TCPClientListener(int port, TCPClientHandler handler)
      Creates a new TCP client listener which listens the network for incoming TCP connections.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getPort()
      Gets the port on which the listener is accepting clients.
      void run()
      Runs the client listening mechanics which is to listen for incoming TCP connections, create communicators and send those back to the game server.
      void stop()
      Stops the listener.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • LOGGER

        ServerSocket

      • port

        private int port
        The network port on which to listen connections.

      • listenerThread

        private java.lang.Thread listenerThread
        The thread in charge of running the client listener mechanics. The client listener is autonomous because it runs its own thread.
        See Also:
        Thread

      • handler

        private TCPClientHandler handler
        The client handler that is passed to created communicators and which enables a client to call the server back when specific events occur.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClientListener

        public TCPClientListener(int port,
                         TCPClientHandler handler)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new TCP client listener which listens the network for incoming TCP connections.
        Parameters:
        port - the network port on which to listen.
        handler - the client handler for communicators that will be created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is already used.

    • Method Detail

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the listener.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the client listening mechanics which is to listen for incoming TCP connections, create communicators and send those back to the game server.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the port on which the listener is accepting clients.
        Returns:
        the port of the server.
